metadata.title: Lines and Angles for Kids
metadata.description: Interactive questions to build understanding of basic geometry concepts
metadata.author: Math Educator

questions.question: What is a point in geometry?
questions.explanation: A point is an exact location with no size - we represent it with a dot.

questions.question: Which of these represents a point?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 200 100'> <circle cx='50' cy='50' r='3' fill='red'/> <line x1='100' y1='30' x2='100' y2='70' stroke='blue' stroke-width='2'/> <rect x='150' y='30' width='40' height='40' fill='pink' stroke='black'/></svg>
questions.explanation: The small black dot on the left is how we represent a point.

questions.question: Which figure shows a ray?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 200 100'><defs><marker id="arrow" viewBox="0 0 10 10" refX="5" refY="5" markerWidth="6" markerHeight="6" orient="auto-start-reverse"><path d="M 0 0 L 10 5 L 0 10 z" fill="black"/></marker></defs><line x1='30' y1='50' x2='70' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='50' x2='170' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)'/><line x1='30' y1='80' x2='170' y2='80' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' marker-start='url(#arrow)' marker-end='url(#arrow)'/></svg>
questions.explanation: The figure with one endpoint and one arrow represents a ray.

questions.question: An angle is formed by:

options.text: Two lines intersection at a point

questions.explanation: An angle is made when two lines or rays meet at a common point called the vertex.
